alert.note: Alert for Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 4:02AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Walker and Dade Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 401 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Cole City to Rising Fawn to near Hammondville, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, La Fayette, Chattanooga Valley, Center Post, Rising Fawn, Noble, Fairview, Stephensville, Linwood, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Cloudland Canyon State Park and Cooper Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
